# Agenda
## Demos (not today)
- Introduction and course overview

- Intro to open source tools for computational social science

## Hack Time
### Setting up a computational working environment
- Create a [GitHub Account](https://github.com/)
- Download [Git](https://git-scm.com/downloads)
- Install [Git](https://git-scm.com/downloads)
- Install [R](https://cran.biotools.fr/) version de base 4.0.3
- Install [LaTeX](https://miktex.org/download)
- Install [RStudio](https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download)
- Create a [DataCamp](https://www.datacamp.com/enterprise/computational-methods-for-social-science/) account and join the class!

### Practice with GitHub, Markdown, and RStudio
- Create a GitHub repository with a README.md file (`.md` files are Markdown files).
- Markdown Tutorial
- Edit and add files to GitHub
- Edit files with RStudio and generate PDF's
